page.title: 01WEST SUSSEX - DUNCTON
page.content:
This area is in the centre of West Sussex between Petworth and the South Downs and consists of Coates, Heathend, Coultershaw and half of Duncton. Much of the land is agricultural - the two main landowners being Barlavington and Leconfield Estates. Tree cover is substantial but not complete and is mostly deciduous.
There are three ponds in the area, Burton, Chingford, and Black, two of which supply power to a renovated water mill at Burton Mill. To the north of Burton Mill the river Rother flows in an east-west direction. Ramblers using the numerous footpaths find peace and tranquility. The whole area is generally regarded as an area of outstanding natural beauty. Personal transport is essential as there is little public transport.
